intro: Hypodiscus gracilis, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy cyathium inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous annual, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are small and clustered, with the female flowers being more prominent and showy than the male ones.
